tit.e: Ichigo Daifuku (Japanese confection made from a strawberry and rice cake)
tit.cmt: 説明追記 （長くなるので簡潔にしました。）

sen.j: いちご大福（いちごだいふく）は、餡を餅で包んだ大福に、イチゴを入れた和菓子の一種。
sen.e: "Ichigo Daifuku" is a kind of Japanese sweets that has a strawberry inside Daifuku, which is a rice cake stuffed with sweet bean paste.
"Ichigo daifuku" is a kind of Japanese confection consisting of a strawberry inside 'daifuku', which is a rice cake stuffed with sweet bean paste.
Ichigo daifuku is a kind of Japanese confection consisting of a strawberry inside 'daifuku', which is a rice cake stuffed with sweet bean paste.

sen.j: 餡は餡菓子の餡を使う地域と、白餡を使う地域がある。
sen.e: Some regions use the regular sweet bean paste found in most Japanese sweets, and others use white sweet bean paste.

sen.j: 餡の他にイチゴのみ、イチゴと生クリームなど、さまざまなものがある。
sen.e: There are various types of Ichigo Daifuku, including one with only a strawberry and another with whipped cream and a strawberry, in addition to the regular kind with sweet bean paste and a strawberry.

sen.j: 生鮮食品であるイチゴを使用するため、冬から春にかけての限定商品として扱われることが多い。
sen.e: As it uses a perishable food product, strawberries, it is often treated as a limited-time product that is available from winter through spring.

sen.j: 元祖を名乗る店は、東京都新宿区住吉町 (新宿区)(大角玉屋「いちご豆大福」)、群馬県前橋市（金内屋）、三重県津市（とらや本家）、三重県伊賀市（欣榮堂）、滋賀県大津市（松田常盤堂）、岡山県倉敷市（甘月堂）など全国各地に点在する。
sen.e: These shops are dotted all over the country, including Osumi Tama-ya Shop that sells 'Ichigo Mame-daifuku' (a kind of Ichigo Daifuku that has a strawberry inside Mame-daifuku, which is a bean rice cake stuffed with sweet bean paste) in Sumiyoshi-cho, Shinjuku Ward, Tokyo Metropolis, Kaneuchi-ya Shop in Maebashi City, Gunma Prefecture, Tora-ya Honke (Tora-ya Shop Originator) in Tsu City, Mie Prefecture, Kinei-do Shop, in Iga City, Mie Prefecture, Matsuda Tokiwa-do Shop, in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, and Kangetsu-do Shop in Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture.
